documenttitle.text: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 3.10 atomic-openshift security update

note.text:
An update for atomic-openshift is now available for OpenShift Container Platform.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
note.title: Topic

note.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform is Red Hat's cloud computing
Kubernetes application platform solution designed for on-premise or private
cloud deployments.

Security Fix(es):

* kubernetes: Incomplete fix for CVE-2019-1002101 allows for arbitrary file
write via `kubectl cp` (CVE-2019-11246)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS
score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE
page(s) listed in the References section.
note.title: Details

note.text: kubernetes: Incomplete fix for CVE-2019-1002101 allows for arbitrary file write via `kubectl cp`
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For OpenShift Container Platform 3.10 see the following documentation,
which will be updated shortly for release 3.10.149, for important
instructions on how to upgrade your cluster and fully apply this
asynchronous errata update:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/3.10/release_notes/ocp_3_10_release_notes.html

reference.Description: bz#1721704: CVE-2019-11246 kubernetes: Incomplete fix for CVE-2019-1002101 allows for arbitrary file write via `kubectl cp`

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank the Kubernetes Product Security Committee for reporting this issue. Upstream acknowledges Charles Holmes (Atredis Partners) as the original reporter.
